1.text: The burden of Babel which Isaiah son of Amos saw.

2.text: Lift ye up a signal upon the bare mountain, lift up the voice to them; move the hand to and fro and they shall come in to the entrances of the noble minded.

3.text: I commanded to the consecrated, also I called the strong ones for mine anger, those exulting in my lifting up.

4.text: The voice of a multitude in the mountain; the likeness of much people; the voice of the uproar of kingdoms, nations being gathered: Jehovah of armies reviewing the army of battle.

5.text: Coming from a land from afar, from the extremity of the heavens, Jehovah and the vessels of his wrath to overthrow all the earth.

6.text: Pipe ye, for the day of Jehovah draws near; as desolation shall it come from the Almighty.

7.text: For this all hands shall be relaxed, and every heart of man shall melt.

8.text: And they trembled; pains and writhings will lay hold of them; as she bringing forth they will be in pain: they shall wonder a man at his neighbor; their faces the face of flames.

9.text: Behold, the day of Jehovah coming fierce and overflowing, and burning anger to set the earth for desolation: and he will destroy the sinner out of it.

10.text: For the stars of the heavens and the giants of the sky shall not shine their light: the sun was darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.

11.text: And I appointed evil over the habitable globe, and upon the unjust their iniquity; and I caused to cease the pride of the arrogant, and I will humble the pride of the terrible.

12.text: I will make a man precious above pure gold, and a man above the gold of Ophir.

13.text: For this I will provoke the heavens to anger, and the earth shall tremble from her place, in the wrath of Jehovah of armies, and in the day of his burning anger.

14.text: And it was as the roe being thrust down and as a sheep and not a man gathering: to his people shall they turn, and they shall flee a man to his land.

15.text: All being found shall be thrust through; and every one scraped together shall fall by the sword.

16.text: And their children shall be dashed in pieces before their eyes, and their houses shall be plundered, and their wives shall be ravished.

17.text: Behold me rousing up the Modes against them, who shall not reckon silver; and gold they shall not delight in it.

18.text: And the bows of the boys shall be dashed in pieces, and the fruit of the womb they shall not pity; and upon their sons their eye shall not have compassion.

19.text: And Babel the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldeesâ€™ grandeur was as God overthrowing Sodom and Gomorrah.

20.text: It shall not be inhabited forever, and it shall not be dwelt in even to generation and generation: and the Arabian shall not go on there, and the shepherds shall not recline there.

21.text: And inhabitants of the desert reclined there, and their houses were filled with howlings, and the daughters of the ostrich dwelt there, and he goats shall leap there.

22.text: And howlers cried out in its palaces, and great serpents in the temples of delight: and her time draws near to come, and her days shall not be protracted.
